column2: -1.3544870886096063 The Easington Hare https://www.thisisdurham.com/inspire-me/durhams-unmissable-highlights/legends-of-durham/the-easington-hare Local lore from Easington tells of a hare that outwitted hunters and hounds until it limped into a cottageâ€”only for the men to find not a hare
column3: but an old woman binding a wounded heel. #approx

column2: -0.15081704101867874 Crazy Kate at Manwar Ings https://lincolnshirefolktalesproject.com/2024/02/06/crazy-kate-the-witch-of-swineshead/ Crazy Kate was a reclusive villager rumored to be a witch
column3: said to slip away at night to the circular earthworks of Manwar Ings to take instruction from the Devil. When the locals finally confronted her there
column4: a mysterious rider spirited her away
column5: after which she vanished and her cottage was burned to the ground. #attrib
